intro: Allostigma, commonly known as the "false orchid," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a specialized lip or labellum that plays a role in pollination. The plants typically have slender stems and produce small, showy flowers with a distinct coloration pattern. Allostigma species are native to regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. They are often found in moist, shaded environments and are adapted to thrive in humid climates.
